Reviews.Title: “Convenient but Noisy. Looks like something out of Pulp Fiction”
Reviews.Author: ljpeas
Reviews.Content: Beds comfortable, bathroom clean (mould on the ceiling), wifi, parking, conveniently located, arrived late at night and the staff were functional, hardly over the top friendly. Noisy and rooms poorly insulated for sound. We paid $110 plus tax, so not bad. Pure 80s Motel Kitsch!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, cheap, clean.”
Reviews.Author: MikeyRyan
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying at the Saharan. The location is perfect. The rooms are perfect. Everything worked fine. It's affordable. It's 80's Hollywood kitch. The duty manager let me check in early after an exhausting 14 hour flight which was a great surprise and a huge relief. The bed was comfortable and there were a big/good selection of television channels (MTV, E! , etc). Didn't eat the free breakfast but it looked basic and fresh. Will most definitely be staying here a 3rd time when I'm back in L.A next!

Reviews.Title: “Can't image a trip to LA without staying at Saharan !”
Reviews.Author: Madame-Minouche
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Saharan which was is a googie mid-century styled hotel very well situated on Sunset Blvd in the heart of Hollywood. My first stay at Saharan was in 1993 and this was my 8th visit so for me it’s like another home! In 20 years, they had several renovations. We enjoyed a very comfortable bed in a clean and spacious room with a useful fridge. There is a TV with cabled channels. In the spotless bathroom you get complimentary soap, shower gel, body lotion and shampoo. In the neighbourhood, you have coin laundry, a liquor shop, Ralphs open 24 hours and Starbucks. The motel is situated at a walkable distance from the world famous Walk of Fame. The staff is very very friendly and helpful. The cleaning staff is very nice, smiling and efficient. We discovered a small cockroach in the microwave oven but it was an isolated incident . I would recommend this hotel and for me of course, there is no Los Angeles without Saharan Motor Hotel. I liked : the staff, the beds, the location, the value I disliked : the really tight parking ! don’t come with a big car !

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect the staff to help”
Reviews.Author: Sean073
Reviews.Content: Seriously what an awful place. The staff are beyond unhelpful. Any request is pretty much met with "meh" The rooms are below average and could be excused if they were quaint and vintage. No they are cheap and going backwards. The free wi fi drops in and out. The included breakfast is awful. Better places in Hollywood to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in the Heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: NickJS_8
Reviews.Content: Basic but clean and affordable Motel on Sunset Boulevard, just a 5 minute walk from Hollywood's main attractions. Good parking and they allowed me to check in 3 hours early and leave the car there. Reasonable breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS, RUDE, DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: KitKat1989
Reviews.Content: After finding bedbugs in my bed was told by the front desk to "deal with it". The room was dirty and smelt horrible. Stay if your game but the service and rude, no hospitality. Hollywoods worst!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in hollywood”
Reviews.Author: broy87
Reviews.Content: this is an affordable motel, clean, free breakfast, pool and close to all the hollywood sights and sounds. just make sure you have or rent a small car as the parking in the rear is really tight.

Reviews.Title: “awesome cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: BE00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awsome for our 4 day stay, it was well priced , we had 3 people in the rromm and it was fine. Within walking distance to Hollywood blvd and short cab ride to clubs on sunset strip front staff wear fantastic and very helpfull. Cleaning lady was great we accidently left $150.00 on the bed and it was still there when we got back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: - Black mold on bathroom wall - Ice cold pool - Rude staff - WIFI didn't work for 10 hours - Bed was like ironing board - Wall outlet didn't work But - great location - close to Ralph's, Pinkberry and strip bars

Reviews.Title: “Great budget beds in Hollwood!”
Reviews.Author: phil3150
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel and booked on the internet from Australia. We arrived early morning via our Airport shuttle, everything was ready, booking was correct, and we wre in a comfy bed 20 mins after we arrived. If there is a downside it is only that you have to climb a set of stairs to reach the upper level, but it is NOT a major issue. In our room we had a queen bed and I think a single. The staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel is close to the "Walk of the Stars" nearby to a large supermarket and several eating places, and we think it is good value for the money. It is NOT the Ritz, but it is not a dump by any means! We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Saharan Motor Hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: catesoo
Reviews.Content: We wanted accommodation near West Hollywood and with parking facilities so we chose the Sahasran. We booked a quadraple room and one with kingsize bed. Both rooms are of identical size and the quadraple room is really too small to sleep four. The keys to the one of the rooms didn't work each time we returned to the hotel and that was annoying. Other than that, the location was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Hollywood & Sunset Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Wrldtraveler365
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of it all! You can walk to great restaurants nearby and not far from the infamous Sunset Blvd and Hollywood Hall of Fame. There is free open parking which is hard to sometimes come across at hotels in LA. Another great factor this hotel is inexpensive. I would recommend staying here and using the saved money on attractions or a nice dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: blondimn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in the area to visit our son who lives in the neighborhood, so the location was prime for that and it was walking distance from Hollywood Blvd. for site seeing. For the price and location, it was fine. No problems with the hotel or staff, they were nice and friendly, though I did have to call 3 times to get a reservation as I was asked to "call back in an hour, we are very busy right now." Housekeeping was accomodating when we needed extra towels, etc. My only critique is the electrical outlets need replacing. They are so old and "loose" that things we would plug in would simply fall right out of the wall with the slightest movement. The continental breakfast was ok but could have been better if offered cereal, yogurt and/or some fresh fruit. If you want to eat toast, waffles or muffins ONLY, this is the place for you. But there's a fridge in the room so buy some yogurt and skip the breakfast. Over all it was fine, we have stayed at Holiday Inn's that have been similar to our stay here and we paid a lot more at the Holiday Inn. Will we return? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Came here twice in one holiday excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: krista h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Saharan after booking on the internet. We did not look at the reviews first which I am glad because it would have stopped us from staying at this friendly motel. We stayed 2 nights. The motel is within walking distance to walk of fame and good shopping and restaurants. Rooms are tidy and clean, bathroom and toilet is clean. The staff are wonderful and very helpful. The receptionist helped us book tours and transport willingly. On our last night in the US we came back to Hollywood. Had previously booked a different hotel for our last night (Hollywood Palms and Suites) which was horrible. The staff were very rude and unwelcoming. We felt unsafe so on the spur of the moment decided to go back to spend the night at the Saharan and luckily for us they had a room avaiable. I would definately recommend this motel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - nothing was too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: JosieJoCamers
Reviews.Content: I picked this blindly off the internet, and couldn't have been happier. The manager helped with booking cars to get all locations (drivers he booked were friendly and extremely helpful). I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting good value for money, location is convenient for the Hollywood walk of fame and Runyon Canyon. Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “friendly and helpfully stay”
Reviews.Author: Vacation_09_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at your hotel and we will do it again, because it was very clean and a nice room. But the best thing was, that the receptionist was so friendly and helpfull to us. He managed some booking stuff for us, printed the way to some locations out and did some important telefonings for us. Breakfast was every day fresh and enought there. And the hotel has got the best place, it is just 2 Blocks away from the special sights and bus is possible in front of the hotel. thanks a lot for such a good stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: Robtex52
Reviews.Content: The main drawback for me was that the beds were not comfortable. They were very hard. The breakfast was very basic -- nothing fresh, nothing above convenience store quality. The pool closed at 8 p.m. which prevents you from enjoying a dip if you get home late. The parking was awful and inadequate for the number of rooms. Things were clean and taken care of well, but I wouldn't stay here again primarily because you need a good night's sleep and the beds didn't afford that.

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it to yourself”
Reviews.Author: Elyce M
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a place where the staff are rude, rooms smell and the staff tell you to clean your own flooded toilet and threaten you... well this is the place for you. After an increasable 14 hour day at Disneyland, my brother, his girlfriend and myself go back to our room to get some sleep but no. After my brother uses the toilet (thankfully only number 1's) he flushes the toilet and the water continuously flows over the bowel onto the floor flooding the bathroom and going out onto the carpet. I go to the front desk to ask if the staff can come and have a look and help us. I was told no! He refused to help or give us gloves and only gave us towels that guests use to dry themselves to clean up the 'mess' on the floor. He would not even give us a mop or change us to another room. I asked for some disinfectant but all he gave us was window cleaner. It took my brother over 16 towels and 2 hours to clean the room. The next morning we went to speak to the manager who was not there. My brother asked for the rest of the stay to be for free for the inconvenience but the staff member said no. He said he would refund out money except not for the previous night. He said it was suspicious for that the toilet overflowed and thinks that we intentionally damaged it. We said we would be putting a review on Trip advisor to let other guest know not to stay here. He threatened us saying he had my brother’s girlfriend’s credit card details and if we put a review on Trip advisor that he would take the whole weeks payment out. We told him that it would be illegal for him to do that and demanded the Credit Card details back or we would be contacting the police. Do your self a favor and never stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Anchelle
Reviews.Content: We actually went here twice, once in March 2010 and once in March 2011. The location is great, it's relatively quiet but close to everything we wanted to see. The rooms are good, they were clean and just big enough. The price is fair in my opinion. However, the pool was almost always (at least partially) in the shadow. Way to cold for me! And, I'd have to agree that parking is not the best, but since we have a small car we were alright. Last of all I must say the staff could have been a little more friendly. They were correct and polite and all, but a smile doesn't hurt. A tip for great dinner nearby would be Cheebo, great pizza and fantastic atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “RUDE IS AN UNDERSTATEMENT!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thespiderman2011
Reviews.Content: We stopped by to see if they had a room. When we asked if his price was the best he could do, he got mad. We asked to see a room (because of previous reviews we wanted to see a room.) He was too busy to show us. We ended up walking out to find another hotel. We refuse to spend our hard earned money with someone who treats us that way.

Reviews.Title: “Aside from the small carpark, the hotel was good!”
Reviews.Author: klee_baker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Saharan at the end of a three week tour of the West Coast for our Honeymoon. We stayed at the Andaz in LA at the very start of our Honeymoon had actually chosen the Saharan at the end as a cheaper hotel for the fact that it is where the video for “DJ DJ” by the Transplants was filmed! Anyway, we got to the Saharan a little early on the day we were checking in, but I thought it was worthwhile seeing if we could check in an hour early anyway. The gentleman on reception checked with housekeeping and was able to check us into our room. The room itself was as was expected – it was clean, king sized bed, bathroom (shower & bath) and a TV. It also had a fridge and microwave in the room. I had no issues with the room itself. There was a pool which seemed to have people there each day, but we did not use the pool ourselves so I cannot comment on the water etc. The car park was the only area of the hotel that I’d say would lose it points in my opinion. There was not very much room to manoeuvre round in the car park – especially if it was full. The gate at the back of the car park was closed at night (which we were not told when checking in). You can still get into the carpark through the front of the hotel, but if you got back to the hotel late at night there was never anywhere to park! I spoke to a man on reception one night but unfortunately struggled to understand his instructions about where additional parking was available. After driving round the block a few times trying to look for the additional parking he mentioned, he ended up getting us to park near the pool which seemed to be a common occurrence based on the number of cars we saw parked there at night! The Saharan is in a good location on Sunset – there are a number of places to eat / drink within walking distance of the hotel. If you want to see the Walk of Fame and Grauman’s theatre etc, then that is in walking distance too – just one road over from the hotel! When we did check in, the staff talked us through tourist attractions available and happily helped us with some of our plans which was good. If you buy a Hollywood Stars tour from reception they arrange for the company to come pick you up from the hotel reception which can be handy if you don’t drive or don’t want to walk over to the tour offices! Overall, the hotel stay was not that bad! If asked if I would recommend the hotel I would say yes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean older style motel”
Reviews.Author: TACCooke
Reviews.Content: Room clean and serviced daily, good location, helpful staff, room is as you see it on the website. Only a 15 minute walk to walk of fame etc, some good cheap restaurants nearby. Complimentary continental breakfast included in rate. Laundromat right next door which was clean and cheap.Overall reasonable value. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: zorichb
Reviews.Content: RUDE is an understatement when dealing with the man at the front desk. Would not let my 20 year old daughter in the room before i came and made her sit outside for 2 hours until we got their. Did not tell us that you only get one parking spot no where near the hotel! Got to the room and i found a bug right on top of the bed. It is in a good location but no worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, heart of the Hollywood, friendly atmosphere, good value, friendly motel employees, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Clintonca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 7212 Sunset Blvd “Sahara Motel “in Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90046, from March 24th to 31st March 2011. It is the best location to live this Sahara Motel, which are located close to HOLLYWOOD BLVD MANN"S CHINESE THEATER. Starbucks, Ralph's Grocery store, Wendy’s restaurant, El Polo Loco restaurant, Burger king fast food restaurant, Subway, several shopping complex are next door to Sahara Motel in Hollywood. There are also Internet Cafe, ROSS Cloth store, 24 hours 7-Eleven store are also next to Saharan Motel. Sahara Motel location wise heart of the Hollywood and easy to get transportation anywhere in the Hollywood. Sahara Motel guests were friendly and helpful to share Hollywood activities and Hollywood cruising. Front desk, employees and room service were knowledgeable about the Hollywood events and competent their jobs. Employees of the Sahara motel were friendly, positive attitude. Sahara motel price was so reasonable so we could afford to stay a week in HOLLYWOOD. Our room was so clean, every day we got maid service to clean our room. Swimming pool was clean, well maintained. The continental breakfast of Sahara Motel was excellent; especially waffles and donuts were served on time. We parked our car inside the Sahara motel, which was free and 24 hours surveillance camera watched our car. We are highly recommended that people who are visiting Hollywood, California, please stay in this Sahara Motel and enjoy Hollywood activities and events

Reviews.Title: “Crap shoot with rooms, can be gross”
Reviews.Author: onewanderer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the location and the reviews seemed decent. I had a king bed reserved. When I checked in, I was given the key to go check out the room to see if it was satisfactory. When I entered it, the smell of chemicals was so overpowering I knew there was no way I'd be able to sleep there. I could barely stand it even with the door wide open. It was a strong bleachy smell, but in addition there was another smell that I can't describe. It actually started to make me feel nauseated. I went to look at another room, which was a queen room instead, and while the bleachy smell was still there, it wasn't nearly as unbearable as the other room so I took it. It wasn't until later that I checked out the room further to discover some gross and disgusting looking stains and other things on the walls, especially in the bathroom, blech!! Later, I was joined by my husband and a friend, who had booked another room. We stopped by for a brief visit in the evening. Other than the same strong bleachy smell, I noticed his room was perfectly fine. It was clean, had some pictures on the wall, had a fridge and mini microwave. Our room didn't have any of these things. The bed is pretty hard and even though it was called a queen room, it wasn't a queen size bed. I wouldn't recommend two people sharing a queen. It was very uncomfortable. If I hadn't seen the other room that was decent looking, I would have given this one star. Seems getting a decent room can be a crap shoot.

Reviews.Title: “great price and clean place”
Reviews.Author: tommygiles
Reviews.Content: located on the strip very cheap clean rooms nice pool two blocks from hollywood blv . I walked everywhere I wanted to go nice staff I stay at alot of hotels around the country this place was great and very clean looks like it had just been remodled I will deff stay here again next time Im in LA

Reviews.Title: “Happy Stay”
Reviews.Author: worldchampionkhan
Reviews.Content: This was an ellent decision to stay at the Saharan motel while visiting in Los Angeles. Front Dest service was prompt and friendly. The pool was clean and warm and the breakfast was excellent, especially waffles. I would highly recomend the stay at this Hotel while visiting Los Angelesis.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Silverstargurl47
Reviews.Content: We spotting a large bed bug crawling on one of the beds at 3 in the morning. A quick search gave us about 10 more on one of the beds. We immediately packed up, notified the front desk, presented them with evidence, and drove an hour home....at four in the morning!!! We are all freaked out that they might have gotten into our suitcases so we are taking precautions, but since those buggers are so resilient we are still freaked out. We have notified the hotel that we would like a partial/full refund for our nonstay. Since we have yet to receive any feedback from them, I would also rate their service a big fat zero. STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good position and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: baz30s
Reviews.Content: We found Raihan on the front desk particularly friendly and helpful to us. He was very knowledgeable about local travel and competent in his job.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: williamjm
Reviews.Content: I usually travel to LA 4 times a yr, have been for the last 20 yrs. Have always stayed at this hotel. It's one of the best in Hollywood, based on room rate, location, and service. Rooms are nice and clean, and they offer a good continental breakfast. The Saharan has a nice swimming pool and free parking. Front desk personnel are friendly and knowledgeable, and housekeepers do their job quite well. I have met and conversed with the manager on many occasions and consider him a friend. I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “"Reasonable"”
Reviews.Author: cmcouto
Reviews.Content: Everything I've read in others reviews was true, except for the coackroaches. It's a reasonable deal, considering the price and the good location. Confort stays in a lower half of an average rate.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, aside from the bedbugs.”
Reviews.Author: completely_beat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting family in the area and spontaneously decided it would be best if we got our own room for the night. We loved the Saharan sign, so we pulled in, were quoted a reasonable rate and decided to stay. We checked out the room before we signed on the dotted line, and it was a bit musty but as seasoned budget travelers, we're used to putting up with things like this. It was a muggy day after a brief heatwave, around 5pm when we checked in and we decided to jump in the pool. It was a bit chilly, but after two minutes, the water was fine. There were some bees and other bugs in the pool, but we just splashed them out as we saw them. We loved the fact that the bathroom had a pedestal sink and that there was a nice fridge in the room for drinks. The cable was good, internet connection fine and parking secure. I woke up in the morning, took a shower and noticed a few red bites on my legs. This really disgusted me, but the motel provides shampoo, soap and lotion, so while I was showering, I felt like I couldn't really be too hard on the motel. MAYBE I got those bites the previous day while hiking at Griffith Park.....maaaaaybe. I decided to try the free coffee in the lobby (fully intending to hit up Cafe Intellegensia later). It was pretty cool that they had a waffle iron ready to go for breakfast, so I tried that out and had a little breakfast time fun. All in all, this motel was fine for my husband and I but it might not work for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - with Roaches and awful customer service - STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: monkgotgroove
Reviews.Content: Upon opening our room door the stench hit us, we walked in, debating whether we wanted to stay & promptly spotted 1, 2, ... 3 roaches. Running out of the room to the front desk, they refused to refund our money (fortunately Citibank saved us from the charge). I would NEVER recommend that ANYONE stay here. There are too many decent hotels within this price range and within this area - no one should pay to spend even an hour in such squalor. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience of my entire life.”
Reviews.Author: customer789
Reviews.Content: When we checked into our room (#112), it was very musky since the A/C hadn't been turned on all day. After about 20 mins of waiting for the A/C unit to cool up, we were getting frustrated because of the heat and the musky scent. To add to our frustration we found 5 roaches in the room. 2 in the bathroom and 3 along the walls of the room. I called the front desk expecting the problem to be resolved but the employee immediately asked for my decision to leave or stay. He was very inconsiderate about how I felt as a customer. He didn't offer any resolutions to the problem. After bickering back and forth about how unreasonable and unprofessional he was an employee, he finally walked into the room and verified that the A/C unit "must not have been working properly at the moment." (Which is what I had been telling him all along!) All in all, we decided to get a full refund and check in elsewhere. Hands down, this is the worst hotel experience I've ever had my entire life!

Reviews.Title: “It was one of the best hotels we stayed in while travelling in CA”
Reviews.Author: suitcase98
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a perfect place to visit Hollywood. It is managed in a very personal and "do-the-best-for-your-guests"- style. The atmosphere is somehow "mediterranean", pool with palm-trees, nice breakfast (we did our own wafers), friendly other guests - I am sure, if we would return to Hollywood, we would stay agein in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “don't waste your money and time”
Reviews.Author: nelllas
Reviews.Content: The good location and relatively good price are the reasons of our booking, but there are plenty of better hotels along Sunset Blvd where to rest. When we opened the room door a terrible smell like naphthalene welcomed us, then we noted an enormous stain on the carpet near the desk. I looked for the refrigerator to cool our drinks anf food (we came from 2 weeks in the national parks) but there wasn't, and neither the microwave was in the room, although in the hotel website it was specified they were in all the rooms. We went to the reception asking to have another room, but a rude guy told us they hadn't another room, and tried to say that microw and fridge are not expected in every room, but I showed him the page of the website I printed at home (to remember all the places we booked)... We asked our money back, since the first thing at our arrive we were requested was the credit card number. After a long discussion with the kindless guy and after a big waste of time, we moved to a much better and cheaper place at short distance. The worst place of our vacantion in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Andera
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my Dad earlier this week. This is a summary of what we found: Pros: 1. Good location. A mere 10 minute walk to Hollywood Blvd's main attractions 2. Reasonable-sized double room with shower facilities, TV, a/c. Cons: 1. No closet, only rails to hang your clothes on. 2. Very small washroom without a counter to put your toiletries on. We ended up using the sink and top of the toilet bowl! 3. Annoying reception staff who kept trying to force us to sign up for tours and insisted that we allow them to call for our airport shuttle (which I declined right till the end). I also witnessed one of the staff being rude to someone who walked in to ask if there were rooms available. 4. Bed bugs! I have bite marks to show on both my arms, legs and back! This incident alone is enough to negate any of the pros which I have stated above. All in all, I would say dont bother. There are many other hotels/motels along Sunset Blvd and even closer to Hollywood Blvd that visitors should probably try.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: TheCantabrian
Reviews.Content: Didnt expect anything but a bed and location close to hollywood blvd and it was exactly that. One thing to point out was the concierge 'Reihan' who's service and assistance was 5 star. I had an issue with a lost phone and he was more than accommodating to help me for which I was very appreciative. For a budget hotel, he set the bar for me customer service wise and I wish him all the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Disrespecful night manager, loud plumbing, dirty carpeting, no closets.”
Reviews.Author: LadyNorthumberland01
Reviews.Content: Although this is a reasonably good location, there are no closets in the room, carpets are stained and the plumbing is very loud. The wireless internet is chancy and the icemaker was broken for the entire stay. Also, one of the evening night managers was extremely disrespectful to me. When the parking lot was full, I was forced to back up a ramp to exit as the door was closed to the interior lot, damaging my car's side mirror. I then parked outside the room, where cars have been parked every night. After I was already undressed and in bed, the night manager insisted that I get out of bed and get dressed to move the car to a side lot. He spoke to me very rudely, and when I pointed out that he was speaking disrespectfully to an older lady, he argued loudly with me and threatened to have my car towed. Its hard to imagine running a business when you are this rude to customers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: sfguy12
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great! it is in a great location, directly across from a large grocery store. it has a large pool, and parking (free), also free wifi service. while the staff may not be overly friendly, they certainly are ok, they did whatever was asked of them, and answered any questions that we had, i was a little leery about the possibility of there being bugs (judging from other reviews), but I am happy to report that there was NOT 1 single bug seen in my room, and i was looking (just in case). for less than $100 a night, this hotel is exactly what one should expect at this price, it was a great deal, and good experience, luckily my room was in the back so the noise of sunset was not a problem, i did however hear people coming and going late, but it was not overly noisy. I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL HIGHLY if you want a basic, comfortable, clean place to say.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service at the Saharan”
Reviews.Author: laurrent
Reviews.Content: Though the location, may appeal you when you check the hotel on the website, this hotel is not worth the price. For sure, you will be a few blocks aways from the Hollywood Boulevard, but the quality of the service is worse than the quality of service I had in a hostel a few days later. When we arrived, the doorman barely told us around the hotel and didn't even offer help with our 4 luggages (there were 2 of us). When we arrived in the room, we ended in a room that did not look cleaned for a few days... Used coffee was still in the coffee machine, the blankets had holes; not to say the beauty of the linen (but let's not stick to the latter :)). It gets worse when the day after, we got a call from the reception at 11am, and the guy told us that if we did not leave the room in the next 5 minutes, he was going to charge us an extra night. What kind of service is that ?! If you think going to this hotel, be aware that you can find other spots in the neighborhood, with easy access to the top locations by foot and at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: rbobiak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Saharan from a recomendation from a friend who had lived in LA and knew we wanted something less expensive. The location was on Sunset and about a 10 minute walk to the Kodak Theatre. We didn't mind the walk to see the attractions, we were pretty central for everything we wanted to see. It is beside a strip club but we didn't have a problem with it. Our room faced the street and it was pretty noisey with the traffic but we tuned it out after a while! Parking is in the back, there are limited spaces but we always were able to get a spot. The staff were friendly, we had a few questions for them and they always helped us out with a smile. The room is dated but we weren't looking for anything fancy with what we paid for it. We never tried the continetal breakfast but it looked like just muffins and coffee in the lobby. We don't have anything negative to say but we did see 2 cockroaches as well....Just caught them and put them outside! If I saw them all the time I would've complained but we weren't worried. For our budget the hotel was all I expected it would be.....I would stay there again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: tmrafeed
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews, we were pleasantly surprised at the overall appearance. Rooms were large and clean. Location was the biggest factor, everything was walking distance, Staff was very helpful, they gave us very good directions, wireless Internet worked very good. overall everything was great for the money in this economy, we were completely surprise.

Reviews.Title: “My friend the roaches”
Reviews.Author: residenciaustralia
Reviews.Content: There is no excuse to wake up in the middle of the night and find two cockroaches sharing your bed. I would find it understandable to find a roach on the floor but not in my sheets. I am sure they felt very comfortable with me during the night and must have done this on a regular basis as they new how to get under the sheets with ease. The two roaches were very quick , incredibly swift in the flee when I realised they were crawling over my body and started to realize the pest invasion I am also sad to say that the roaches were killed but their brothers were not and the ordeal continued. I had to insist to get a new room and to be on the safe side I bought a big can of poison and killed everything alive in the new room before going to bed. This I do not recommend as it is not very healthy but humans can take a lot more poison than roaches. The hotel did not offer any compensation not money back for the problems. I had no strenght left to keep on complaining and made friends with the roaches until I left.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for cheap then look no further”
Reviews.Author: NicoleN
Reviews.Content: You defiantly get what you pay for here. So for roughly 50 quid a night in central Hollywood please don’t expect much and, as my husband and I didn’t, we were not disappointed. It’s exactly as we expected cheap noisy and extremely basic. The free car park was a bonus but I really wasn’t sure if the car was going to be there in the morning or not. The guy on reception was polite enough; Breakfast isn’t work the effort, wifi connection sporadic. Beds uncomfortable, carpet was dirty so we never walked on it bare foot; the noise from the street at night is full on. It seemed to quieten around 0300 I wish I could say the same for the noise from the room upstairs (I wouldn’t recommend parents bring kids here if you know what I mean!) This is not a great area and for those first times to LA I would advise you to stay more West Hollywood as it’s a much safer area with a completely different feel to it. Hollywood boulevard itself is like London’s Piccadilly Circus great to visit but nothing much to hang around for. In all if you’re looking for a very basic hotel then you have found it in the Saharan Motor motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Purple85
Reviews.Content: Can't really fault our stay at the Saharan, the maids came in every day to change the towels etc, pool was nice, I think most people stay here to see the sights so not many people around the pool which can be a good thing! Rooms were clean, had free wifi, best thing was definately the location. Just a short walk from the tourist hotspots like Walk of fame, Madame taussads, Kodak theatre. The hotel staff sorted out car rental for us which they arrived at the hotel to pick us up and gave us a good deal. For what you pay you can't complain at all!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for but its fine”
Reviews.Author: pete_does_stuff
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights en route to a few weeks in San Francisco. The bed is comfortable but the room simply has aircon and television. There was no bar fridge or any way to keep things cold, and the toilet was a little ordinary but apart from that, all was good. There are dining options all around the place on Sunset and a 24 hour Raplhs grocery store across the road with all your beverage, pharmacy and food needs. The staff were fine - not overly enthusiastic but everything that was asked was delivered. Hollywood Walk of Fame and some attractions are within a five minute walk up La Brea and on to Hollywood Boulevard, so for the tourist, this is ideal. I also caught a bus downtown which took about half an hour and went all the way along Sunset and through the Jewellery District. A short bus ride away, West Hollywood is full of attractions and the bus ride is just $1.25. The room was serviced daily and the towele are refeshed daily. There is a pool which is lovely if you want some sun and swimming. I can recommend the hotel as a budget option and is suitable for a short stay in Hollywood if you want to be close to everything. The free wireless internet ws great - i was basically logged on for 4 days without issue.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable + Clean + refurbish”
Reviews.Author: sebastian1974
Reviews.Content: Quite good hotel with parking space. the rooms were clean. If you are looking for a great breakfast this is not the hotel, but it was quite enough (coffe + wafle + muffin), but you can pick it up near the check in area and take it to your room. You can go to the Kodak theatre by foot, it is only 6 blooks. You can find a a great restaurant just in front of the hotel. Do not spect helpful advice from the hotel personnel, they are not willing to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: diamond6Phoenix_AZ_
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my birthday week and was very surprised in a good way. The previous review scared me but I had no problems whatsoever. The location is great and the hotel has recently been redone. I stayed here for one whole week and it was all good. The maid service was very good, the hotel was quiet and I was able to walk to starbuck's and ralph's supermarket. The following week I stayed at another property with a friend which was rated better but I should have stayed here as this was the better property. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They lied to me and cannot be trusted”
Reviews.Author: Corky59
Reviews.Content: I called ahead to make sure I could use cash for a room. Was told that would be fine just leave a $50 deposit. When i arrived from Miami with my bag in tow, the desk attendent looked me up and down and siad I had to have a credit card. No cash. I explained my phone call the day before, told him I was a graduate student in town for a screening of one of my films for a showcase and he barely replied. Without looking at me he just said "no card, no room" He was without a doubt one of the rudest, coldest, meanest people I have ever met. I would not tell my worst enemy to go to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: gizmo_thunder
Reviews.Content: Was there on my tourist trip from Croatia to LA and Hollywood with my girlfriend and we had very pleasant time there. Only drawback was pretty old toilet (it had some rust on it, but generally it was OK and clean). Free WiFi, pool, breakfast (thought it was only coffee and muffin ;) As many young people stay there, be prepared for quite noisy evenings and nights. Bottom line - you will hardly find a better place to stay for that price ($80 p/n, tax included). If you want a place just to sleep and rest with an excellent location, this is right choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Frandan
Reviews.Content: Good price, excellent location right on Sunset Blvd only a few minutes walk to the Hollywood Walk of Fame and all its attractions. Very pleasantly suprised with this one considering some of the reviews. We arrived very early by 9am - went to check in and the lovely clerk (male) kindly arranged for a room to be cleaned immediately for us. We had a room on the top floor towards the back which was very private and comfortable. Stayed 4 nights with no problems at all. Ok, the hotel looks a little dodgy (neon lights and some girly bars just around the corner etc) but it is clean, tidy and secure and right near all the attractions of Hollywood at such a great price. Parking is free, so is the wifi internet. We did not have the cont. breakfast - RALPHS is right across the street for all your grocery needs. The room was equipped with fridge and microwave. As advised by the clerk, I probably wouldn't venture out much at night. But overall - next visit to LA we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on Sunset Strip”
Reviews.Author: MrMcCain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Saharan for 3 nights and if you are like us and are just looking for somewhere to sleep and shower then its ideal. It does look a little shabby from the outside with a large flashing neon sign but the rooms are spacious and clean and well looked after. It has a small swimming pool and the rooms are air conditioned. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the walk of fame and about a 10 min drive to Beverley Hills. If you are looking for somewhere to drink then its $10 in a taxi to the clubs and bars of Hollywood. So if you are looking for something on a Budget then I would reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: sylvain007
Reviews.Content: We stopped here because we were stuck in the traffic of the Sunset Blvd. The room we cheap (80$ for a king), a lot of availability, free wifi, free parking. Simple Inn room, but better than the really cheap inn. It smells the cheap soap, but it is clean and everything is there (hair dryer, bath tub, desk ...). The second night, we tried the jacuzzi room, that is big but not very nice (simple) and quite expensive (170$ on Friday). No late check out (2 calls after 11am) and service not really friendly. The location is very good for Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Saharan Motel Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: chachany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Saharan Motel for one night. the location is alright,very close to Hollywood Blvd. The receptionist very unfriendly, the "breakfast" was a joke. the room was alright, but too expensive for what you get

Reviews.Title: “Pretty suprised with this one....”
Reviews.Author: Fredrock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on June 23rd after seeing this little motel listed in one of those Hotel Coupon books that I picked up from a rest area along Hwy 5 coming from the Bay Area. I picked this place because I was attending an expo at the LA convention center and I was planning to hit the Hollywood night life at night. I called first to see if they had a room available as hotels on Sunset Blvd can get booked pretty fast on weekends. Of course the prices are higher on weekends. I checked in about 3pm and got the room in a flash. From the outside the hotel looks like in good shape. I had room 216 which was upstairs and around the corner. The room was clean and plenty of towels. Looks like they just recently rennovated the place. Nice tiles on the bathroom shower walls. A fridge and a working air conditioner. No alarm clock in the room, nor telephone book either. The walls are super thin. I can hear the couple next door in room 317 having a little fun (if you know what I mean.) There is Ralph's supermarket right across the street (sometimes you can see stars shopping). There is a strip club right next door and another one around the corner going towards Melrose Ave. The neighbor hood is ok. Plenty of people walking around at night if you stay on the strip. If you exit the hotel, to the left are all the clubs like Saddle Ranch and The Standard. (I usually stay at the Hyatt or my favorite Best Western Sunet Plaza when I like to party on Sunset...but was too late on booking a room) I saw a group of girls walking towards the clubs but I think it's too far to walk, especially coming back after dancing and drinking all night but you can always take a cab back. After the expo I attended in downtown LA (ooh that LA traffic!!!) I got back to my room about 10pm and parking was pretty tight but it was secured (and it's free...some places charge for parking). If you have a SUV this can be very very tight. Back to my room after an eventful expo and then I can hear my neighbors at it again. Pretty funny too me!! My room was on the side of the building so you can hear the Sunset Strip noise. It didn't bother me and it wasn't too loud. When I checked out I wanted to see if I left anything under the bed. Under the bed was clean but in between the matress was a dirty men's underwear (NASTY!!!) and behind the TV was an newspaper that was too tight to reach. Check out was a breeze and they had wrapped danishes for breakfast along with coffee and OJ. Don't expect a full breakfast because a lot of people do. IHOP is close by. Like I said before my favorite place to stay is the Best Western Sunset Plaza because it's right there where the party is at on Sunset but this place did it's job. If you are on a budget then this place is good. If you are not a budget and wanna party go for the Best Western Sunset Plaza or the Hyatt but it can be at least a $100 more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - at $65”
Reviews.Author: emilly1226
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. This hotel was close enough that I was able to walk back and forth. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel next time I'm in Hollywood. Desk clark is very helpfull but no help for luggages. Very bad breakfast, too tight parking space. emilly1226@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Bugs all over you! Managed by thieves!”
Reviews.Author: psullivan
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel! There are bugs everywhere. We were talked into changing rooms after the first one we had was infested with bugs! 2 hours later, when we turned out lights out there were bugs everywhere crawing on the pillows and the bed. My fiance has 2 huge welts from being bitten! We left in the middle of the night and the staff was rude and actually laughed at us and called us foolish for trying another room. They would not refund our money and I have had to go to my credit card company and report it as a fraud! I have never been in a more disgusting hotel, nor have I been treated SO badly by the staff of a hotel. Do not stay at this place unless you like being treated like garbage by both the management and the bugs!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service at the Saharan”
Reviews.Author: SleepyTime
Reviews.Content: Went to check in after 2 days of driving and were told upon arrival that our room was a smoking room. We booked a non-smoking room. The man at the desk insisted that smoking was what we ordered. We showed him the print confirmation to prove we chose non-smoking. He basically didn't want to find us a non-smoking room and told us to leave after we complained. Thank goodness for the Days Inn down the road, which is where we had to stay upon our fiasco arrival, they were very nice and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: Kat21
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Saharan on the 31/07/06 for 5 nights in a standard queen room. Firstly, I would absoulutly recommend this place if you are on a budget and want a decent place to stay. Compared to some other hotel we stayed at in the USA, this place was very good. We arrived early and as our room was not ready for an hour we were able to leave our bags there while we went and had lunch. I also beleive we were given an early check in being 11.00am as most hotels in America had a check in time of 3.00pm. I contacted the hotel direct and received a rate of $69.99 US plus tax, which was a lot cheaper than many other hotels in the area I had contacted. The room appeared clean, despite a couple of carpet stains which didnt bother me as I know these are unavoidable ( I am also in the Tourism Industry). Our room had a mini fridge and microwave which was fantastic, but you do have to request these as they are not in all rooms. There is a supermarket across the road which was very handy. Being on Sunset Boulavard it is only a 10 minute walk to the Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre and Walk of Fame which are all on Hollywood Blvd amongst other things. The airconditioner did a good job but was a bit noisy at night when you are trying to sleep. We used the pool once and it always looked very clean and well maintained. We didnt take advantage of the free breakfast but you have to be early to get it. In Australia I would say that this hotel is the standard of a 3.5 star. It was clean, cheap and in a great location. I would very much consider staying here again and would not hesitate in recommending it to others. You are only at the hotel to sleep so dont waste you money on an expesive hotel-Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: DBCooper
Reviews.Content: Really quite a good value! Right in the thick of things, free parking, free wireless internet. This was my first stay at The Saharan. It's right on Sunset, right across from Ralph's supermarket. There was a little frige in the room which was very convenient-- and it was already cold when I got there. There had been a mistake in my reservation, and I ended up with a smoking room. Although the deskman was a bit chiding, he wasn't unpleasant and I was allowed to change rooms immediately, although it's rather hilarious that a non-smoking room is more expensive! I paid the difference and was glad. I was upstairs, around the corner, away from the pool, which was fine. The room smelled wonderful and everything looked new. There were not quite enough hangers, but I was able to accommodate my clothing in one way or another. It would have been problematic if I hadn't been alone. The pool is very pretty and clean. The pix on the Saharan web site show another small pool, but that wasn't evident anywhere I could see.The A/C was magnificent. The wireless internet reception was iffy where I was, but I really was quite a way from the office, and if I carried my laptop onto the stairs, I got a full-throttle connection. The room phone's ring was pleasant. I had to put a $20 deposit on an ironing board and iron, but I got it right back when I brought the iron and board back to the office. I was in town for business, so I spent most of my time away from the hotel, but it was exceedingly nice to anticipate the cool room. Everything was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “very clean room”
Reviews.Author: chadboy69
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean, staff was friendly, a very reasonable rate for the motel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Saharan Motor hotel at 10 am and the rooms weren't cleaned yet (checkout is at 11am) but the managers did everything to get us in a room ASAP. We were treated very good and had a clean and spacious room. This hotel is very close to Hollywood boulevard and the Hollywood-Highland subway and bus station (just go up La Brea and take a right). With the subway you go very fast to downtown LA or even LAX (int. airport). I think it's a very good price for a very nice place to stay. And with a supermarket across the street you have everything you need. We were here as the last stop on a road trip through California and had already returned our rental car, but didn't really need it anymore because everything was so close by.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better! This hotel is great!”
Reviews.Author: Limerep1
Reviews.Content: I read about The Saharan Motor Hotel at Tripadvisor, and it looked great by the reviews. When we got there I was impressed, it was even better than expected. Nice clean rooms og bathrooms, equipped with TV, AC, refrigerator and even a microwave oven! The rooms a located away from the street, and they have their own parking lot in the backyard. We didn't use the pool, but it looked okey. The location is also great, at the Sunset Boulevard, in walking distance to Hollywood (Kodak Theatre, Grauman's Chinese Theater, Hollywood & Highland Center and many nightclubs) and The Sunset Strip! There are many dining possibilities right across the street, and a supermarket (Ralphs) which is open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. They've got everything you need ;) The price is only $70 per night for a room with two dobbel beds (queen size), even if you are two, three or four persons ;) Everyone I travelled along with was also very satisfied. We will definitely stay here again, and we highly recommand the Saharan Motor Hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Budget bulls-eye!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm a local LA person temporarily living in Europe. Had five days in LA to visit the tax man and catch up with friends. Didn't want to spend an arm and a leg. Felt kind of funny, considering I was staying in my own home town. Chose the Saharan based on location and price. $80 bucks/nite, tax included, booked thru Tripadvisor/Expedia. And what a great choice it was! Yes, it's east of West Hollywood, but only by a couple of cross streets. The place is scrupulously clean, with daily maid service. All rooms located on two stories face inward, courtyard style. I had a non-smoking upstairs, with its back to Sunset Blvd. It wasn't particularly noisy. The room itself was fairly large, with a comfortable king size bed. There's a desk, a fridge (ask for it, not all rooms have it, apparently,) a microwave, a TV with HBO but for some reason not many other channels, and a long shelf with a rack below to hang your clothes. No closet space per se and no in-room safe, so lock your suitcase or store your valuables with the management. I liked the Bangladeshi guys who manned the reception very much. At first they were gruff, but they soon warmed up and we ended up trading stories about living abroad. There's some sort of breakfast, but I think it's restricted to donuts and coffee. There's a Whole Foods nearby if you want good, healthy stuff, and of course [Rock'n'Roll]Ralph's supermarket directly across the street. A laundromat is located right next to the motel. Parking was a little tricky (narrow spaces) but manageable in a secured lot behind the building. There's also extra unsecured outside parking along the building wall on the west side of the motel. There's a mix of motel guests, ranging from families to rowdy party types. I always felt very safe though (I'm female, traveling alone) and I had no problems or other security issues. During the weekend, the place was up to capacity, but during the week it was fairly quiet. I never saw anyone in the pool, which looked clean and well-maintained. The rooms have indvidual cooling/heating. The bathrooms are sparkling clean. Good shower. Bring your own hair dryer, otherwise you'll need to ask for one. I didn't spend much time in the room and when I was there, I kept the curtains closed, since people walk right by the windows. That's the only drawback to this otherwise excellent place, in that it tends to make the room a little dark. But if you don't care, I'm sure others won't as well. In sum, I'd stay there again, if I wanted to save money. The price, the location, the convenience...unbelievable. And to think that the Mondrian a few blocks west charges hundreds of dollars more for its depressing, hospitallike rooms..or the overpriced Standard on Sunset, with its prisonlike, shag carpeted, crappy trend-excuse for a hotel...so yeah, this was another great LA deal, take it from a local!

Reviews.Title: “great for budget”
Reviews.Author: cordan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner for two nights and for the price have no complaints. Good location and clean room. If possible ask for a room off the main road as I think that they would be pretty noisy or just bring some earplugs. Staff at front desk not overly welcoming but that kind of adds to it. Just remember this is a budget hotel and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “reputation alone is not the making of a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: QPRJAMES0
Reviews.Content: i think my title says it all.... i have stayed here often and enjoyed my stay, and as you can so so have many other travellers. but i think thge management here are now just resting on their laurals. they dont seem to care much, nor do they put the effort in that you'd expect from a small independant budget hotel such as this. my advice is try other hotels in the area. you can find reasonably priced accom offering much better service. you just have to look a bit harder thats all. stay clear!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Saharan”
Reviews.Author: SophRen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hollywood for New Years Eve. What a blast. The Saharan was great. Nice hotel room with clean bath. Important for girls. Situated street side noise from traffic high but didn't mind went to bed at 3am anyway. Across the street from some very good restaurants. Loved it. Handy for the Guitar Center. Rock on.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Saharan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Keeping in mind that this review is in the context of budget holidays, the Saharan was an extremely impressive place to stay. The rooms were all clean and were cleaned regularly throughout our three week stay. The bed was king size, with a large TV with over 20 channels, AC and an adequate bathroom. They provide coffee in the reception area which was always available. They also provided pastries and fruit juice in the mornings from 7.30am till 9.30am, but it tended to be there until it ran out really. When we got there and were put in a non smoking room by mistake, the staff were quick and helpful in moving us. The staff were friendly and helpful, even the quieter members, and they called us taxis, let us store our stuff when we checked out and arranged tours for us with hotel pickups - Disneyland etc. They gave us advice on this and amenities in the local area. Speaking of which there is a Ralphs supermarket across the street and a great chinese takeaway next door on the left....Green Tea Chinese....we would definitely recommend for nights in! And there are plenty of places to eat out nearby - Bossa Nova for one. The pool and lounger area was pleasant and clean and all the other hotel guests were fine. The place is in a great location with Hollywood Bvld one block up and other attractions a cab ride away...the furthest we went in a cab was Santa Monica for like 30 dollars. It was only 15 to Universal Studios. Staying there for 3 weeks we really got to know the place and the staff were just as you would want them...there when you needed them but left you alone the rest of the time. Although it's not really a family place due to the location and the fact that the amenities are really geared towards the fact that it is a motor hotel, we would recommend it to anyone else. Although we didn't use it we saw plenty of people by the pool using the wireless internet, and there was a telephone in the room. At an extremely reasonable price The Saharan is indeed the best place to stay on Sunset Bvld and we would definitely return and recommend. Our once in a lifetime experience was definitely added to by our choice of hotel. We would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Budget hotel, W/ Free Wi-Fi!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm actually curently writeing this from my room. Its very clean. I was surprised at the price for a single, considering the central location and clean and well maintained look of it all. I was primarily looking for a dirt cheap bed to sleep in with internet so I could do some work. The front desk area was also surpriseingly clean and welcomeing. The clerk was not rude but not outwardly freindy either. Overall I would highly recomend it for a single or a couple for a stay while being centrally located. There is a pool but I would not picture this to be a family area. Walls are a bit thin.

Reviews.Title: “The best budget hotel on The Strip!”
Reviews.Author: PLSURFER
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of dive hotels on this section of Sunset Strip, I mean places that are truly scary looking. The Saharan is not one of these! Friendly staff, great location and best of all, the best price you are going to find in the area. Keep in mind that this is budget priced hotel, so don't expect five star amenities. Very basic rooms, but very clean and neat. This area of Sunset is just West of Hollywood High School and is a little bit run down but not terribly. There is a Ralph's supermarket right across the street as well as 7-11 a few blocks East. This is a well located hotel, you are very close to all the major Hollywood attractions, in fact, within walking distance. If you are a musician and/or a music nut, there is a huge Guitar Center and several other shops just a block away. I would also recommend Ameoba, a very cool record store up near Vine. Like in any big city, I would not walk around the immediate area late at night. It is not super bad, but just keep your awareness level up. You will do best if you ask for an upstairs room in the back, that way you are further from the busy Sunset Strip as well it is an older building and it will probably be a little noisy in a downstairs room. The staff was very accomodating to my request on Memorial Day weekend, and I really think that this is the best value in the area!

HotelInfo.Name: Saharan Motor Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 7212 Sunset Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90046
